title: Newcastle desperate to keep Matty Longstaff at the club with his £850 a week deal running out
text:
Steve Bruce says Newcastle United will be doing their utmost to make sure they do not lose Matty Longstaff at the end of this season.

The 19-year-old scored the winning goal against Manchester United on his Premier League debut before the international break.

However, Longstaff’s £850-per-week deal expires next summer and he would be free to talk to foreign clubs from January.

Steve Bruce says Newcastle must do their utmost to keep hold of Matty Longstaff

MATTY LONGSTAFF IN 2019-20 Appearances: 2 Minutes: 180 Goals: 1

The teenager’s contract situation has now been flagged as a priority - as has that of his brother Sean - and Bruce said: ’It’s going to be above me. Lee Charnley (managing director) will be on with that, but we’ll do our utmost to make sure we don’t lose our best young players.

‘I’m sure we’ll be all out to get that tied up – and his brother, which is vitally important. There are one or two that are in discussions with the club, and I’m sure we’ll move that on in the next week or two.’

Sean, 21, signed a new deal last December, one month before he broke into the first team. However, progress on a new six-year contract has stalled and Manchester United retain an interest in the midfielder.

Matty and brother Sean discuss victory over Manchester United at St James' Park

The brothers will start at Chelsea on Saturday after Bruce confirmed that Matty has retained his place.

‘How could I leave him out?’ he said.

‘You can imagine what the kid’s been like (the past fortnight), he’s been like a kid in a sweet shop.

‘It’s been quite refreshing for all of us to witness the TV interview (after his debut). He beamed out of the television. It brought a refreshing humility to us all and it was a wonderful debut for the kid.

Bruce says Longstaff has been 'like a kid in a sweet shop' since opening his Newcastle account

‘We have to protect him and nurture him along the way because he’s got a big future ahead of him. He’s got to handle all that comes. Hopefully, we can help him in that respect.

‘But I don’t think I’ve witnessed as a good a debut. It wasn’t just the goal, that capped it too, it was the way he played in the whole game. It was terrific.

‘From day one, he’s been knocking on the door. It was always a case of when do I put him in. The circumstances were right. Since I joined up with the squad in China, he’s the one that’s constantly performed well in training and his enthusiasm is there for everybody to see.’
description: Steve Bruce says Newcastle United will be doing their utmost to make sure they do not lose Matty Longstaff at the end of this season. The 19-year-old scored against Manchester United.
